website_summaries.verdict: Panasonic's Lumix DC-GX9 camera is smaller and less expensive than the GX8 that came before it.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations
customer_reviews.text: Compact, light weight and excellent selection of glass. A minor upgrade from the LUMIX GX7 which I used for several years. The Lumix GX series was first purchased to take photos of construction sites where I needed to carry it up ladders and stairs but it quickly became my go to camera system for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Strange Package Alterations
customer_reviews.text: First impressions: Love it 100x over for future treks and travel vs my DSLR Canon system (boat anchor). There is a lot to learn about yhis computer...er, camera, with both basic and advanced manuals, but anyone can manage the point and shoot. I am curious why Camera Mall put white stickers all over the UPC codes. It sure wasn't priced as a grey market item and not easy to register a warranty this way.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Graham

customer_reviews.title: Wow what a camera
customer_reviews.text: The versatility is very good. I use it many different ways, as an instant camera for casual shots, or to shoot still life's, portraits, when I need something more than an instant camera. You need to know there are more than 200 menus offering countless options for adjustments. The adjustments are easy, and once it is setup, using it is a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Glassbrenner

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with great ergonomics, all is excellent except the kit lens.
customer_reviews.text: I love small cameras with strong video capability. So this is it. I've owned the gx7, gx85 and now got the 9. Great ergonomics, small, light. Compared to previous model - I can't say that the difference in image quality is that large, but the ergonomics is better. My only complaint - I'd prefer to buy body only, without the kit lens, for I have enough lenses and this zoom, while not terrible, is very mediocre.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Shoyhat

customer_reviews.title: Amazing MET camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera on sale for around $799 with the 12-60 lens. Amazing MFT camera. Great for street photography and action shots too.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: You will not be disappointed with this camera. Incredibly easy to use for the novice with all the features of a professional camera with a fraction of the weight. I upgraded after several years of use from my gf3. This is like going from the camera obscura to a top of the line dslr. Ok, maybe not all that but it’s A LOT more camera than the unit I replaced and all my lenses and accessories work perfectly on it. I love this camera!
customer_reviews.author: crip4pits

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, terrible ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: Most uncomfortable camera I've ever used. Sure, you can buy a grip for it (For an outrageous price). But then every time you want to use a tripod, you've got to take it off. Larger lenses also make it much more uncomfortable. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Solsticeman

customer_reviews.title: Worth it and more
customer_reviews.text: This nifty thing takes great photos and surprisingly good film. The auto mode is enough for a most settings and then some small adjustments in Lightroom will yield great pictures without breaking your bank.
customer_reviews.author: Liz P

customer_reviews.title: Value for $$$
customer_reviews.text: Great camera both indoors and out. Took to DC vert happy with the quality of pictures
customer_reviews.author: Cycling Cindi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for traveling. The bluetooth and wifi capabilities are a bit baffling. The phone app kinda sucks. Get the panny 25mm lens ... the 167 dollar one ... not the leica. They are very similar but the panny is 400 bucks less. Make sure you upgrade the firmware to 1.1 on the lens and camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is true to the colors, shutter is quite light. It is a good camera for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: No regrets on this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like the out of camera jpgs for this camera. It's too early at this point to say anything about the RAW files as very few RAW developing programs support the camera. I've shot photos with a number of lenses (25mm prime, 12-60mm f3.5, 12-60mm f2.8, 14-140mm) and all look good as far as color and image quality. I used to have a GX85 and this is definitely an "upgrade" from that camera although each person will have to decide if the differences are worth the cost. I wanted a smaller m43 for times when my other cameras were too large or heavy. This is a nice size for walking in parks and cities. Not too obtrusive but very functional.
customer_reviews.author: LarryW

customer_reviews.title: Great MIcro Four Thirds Camera
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Nice step up from the LUMIX GX7. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nelson

product_meta.title: PANASONIC LUMIX GX9 4K Mirrorless ILC Camera Body with 12-60mm F3.5-5.6 Power O.I.S. Lens, DC-GX9MS (USA SILVER)
product_meta.description:
Color:SilverFirst in Mirrorless innovation, LUMIX by Panasonic leads in Mirrorless ILC camera innovation with the sleek, compact LUMIX GX9. Its flat body style is favored by LUMIX G enthusiasts and noted for high image quality and the streetwise creative freedom it delivers. The LUMIX GX9 captures vibrant, true-to-life, high-quality images with excellent resolution, high contrast and impressive color reproduction. The 20.3-megapixel Digital Live MOS Sensor (without low-pass filter) ensures maximum performance across a full range of LUMIX G and LEICA DG Micro Four Thirds lenses.

The LUMIX GX9 incorporates 5-axis Dual I.S. (Image Stabilizer) to more effectively suppress blur. Combining an O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer, 2-axis) and a B.I.S. (Body Image Stabilizer, 5-axis), the 5-axis Dual I.S. compensates for a wider-than-ever range of movement. Users can enjoy blur-free photo/video shooting from wide to tele, even in low-light situations. The LUMIX GX9 integrates an electromagnetic drive in the shutter unit to reduce the shock created by the movement of shutter diaphragm by approx. 90% compared with its predecessor, while also minimizing shutter sound.
feature_bullets: [20.3 MP] high-resolution MOS Sensor with Tuned Three-Dimensional Color Control to detect hue, saturation and brightness for optimal results
[5-Axis Dual I.S.] combines an O.I.S. (Optical Image Stabilizer, 2-axis) and a I.B.I.S.(In-Body Image Stabilizer, 5-axis); 5-axis Dual I.S. enables up to 4-stop slower shutter speeds
[Live View Finder] 2760k-dot high-resolution LFV tilts up by approx. 80 degrees with nearly 100% color reproduction; 1.39x / 0.7x (35mm camera equiv.) magnification and 100% field of view
[49 Focus Points] plus Custom Multi AF mode quickly and freely select focus blocks from via the touch-enabled LCD screen
[4K Technology] 4K 30p video, 4K Live Crop and 4K PHOTO burst with a new Light Composition mode to capture perfect moments
